items.sentence: The blood on the towel found in Tom\'s car was his own.
I can finally tell you about what I did during the war.
Do you want to live with Tom for the rest of your life?
If Tom had had time to do that, I\'m sure he would\'ve.
Tom bragged about how well his son was doing at school.
You can\'t just make everyone do what you want them to.
I don\'t think that I need to tell Tom about our plans.
I don\'t think that Tom knows where the post office is.
I don\'t think that anybody noticed what Tom was doing.
Has your new novel already been translated into French?
I asked Tom if there was something I could buy for him.
I don\'t think anybody else noticed what Tom was doing.
Didn\'t you know Tom lived in Boston when he was a kid?
I don\'t know how much time it\'ll take Tom to do that.
Tom was awoken by a Mary singing in the next apartment.
Tom bumped into Mary this morning on his way to school.
I don\'t think these guys really want to hear Tom sing.
I don\'t want Tom wandering around the mall by himself.
We are looking for someone who is proficient in French.
I\'m not sure Tom is going to be willing to talk to me.
